OverrideBothEqualsAndHashcode.description:
Description

Override bothpublic boolean Object.equals(Object other)andpublic int Object.hashCode()or override neither.
Even if you are inheriting ahashCode()from a parent class, consider implementinghashCode()and explicitly
delegating to your superclass.

Not overriding both methods could violate the contract betweenequals()andhashCode(). Most importantly,
if two instances are equal, then they must have the same hash code. Using such invalid instances in hash-based
collections likeHashSetorHashMapcould lead to duplicated or missing entries.

This rule does not consider types that implementComparable. There is a separate ruleOverrideBothEqualsAndHashCodeOnComparablefor this.

Example(s):

Use this rule by referencing it:
OverrideBothEqualsAndHashcode.option: This rule has no specific options.
